review: It's great, I use it daily, I'd buy another one before I got one of the other media streamers.  Amazon GUI is ok, speed is just fine for the price, I like the remote (though maybe I missed some instructions somewhere, e.g., I figured this out by playing around: hold down the home button to bring up a menu to put the stick to sleep), like the app too.  Two complaints though.  First is because I have an older cable modem (DOCSIS 2.0) so my internet may cause the streaming to freeze up occasionally.  I unplug and and replug fire stick and back in business.  Second, my 4 year old boy took the remote apart, twice.  Somehow it still works.  So maybe it's not a complaint.
author: Chris Kunde

review: My son got one and loved it, but mine doesn't work correctly.  I am a Prime member.  I start a Prime video and a few minutes into it I get a screen telling me I don't have rights and it will start over...again and again.  I can't use it...so it was a waste of money.
author: Donna S Hawkins

review: I thought I would try out the Amazon Fire TV Stick and compare to my chromecast.  I am a prime member and usually use the app on my tv since Amazon doesn't allow you to cast via chromecast.  As of today, if I had to choose I would go with chromecast.  Amazon Fire Stick, lags in the beginning of my shows, lose picture and sound for about 3 secs, through the first 2 minutes (it drops 3-4 times).  I tried HBO go app and I had to restart it 4 times before able to play with the fire tv.  I like the fire tv for my amazon prime shows, but truly prefer my ipad for the layout.  I will continue to use the fire tv, but really do not for see purchasing another one.
author: sugar & spice

review: I've only been using the Amazon Fire TV Stick for about 3 weeks.  While I primarily use it to watch Youtube learning videos with my two year old and have watched only a couple of movies so far, I must say that the Youtube streaming is slow for some reason, causing it to hang up a lot, which makes my two year old son impatient. We have a Smart TV in another room and the Youtube streaming is perfectly fine when using that TV to watch Youtube videos.  I was hoping that buying this stick would allow me to save money by not spending more on Smart TVs, but I may need to rethink this.  Bummer.  I should say, though, that the two Prime movies that I watched did not have any streaming problems.  Only Youtube for some reason.  I haven't tried everything else.
author: JGPtArthur

review: It was easy to install and a wide variety of movies and tv shows to watch. Love it!

review: Works amazing! Easy setup! Much better than my chrome cast by Google worked!
